column4: Yeah, I thought automatix was the electronic equivalent of the dipping bird...?
Exactly!
Only 5 responses out of 634 users :)
half of which are idle...  so that ain't bad
It's not as technical a question.
enlightenment ?
that's it!
Yeah, I can't wait for dr17... of course, the last major release was october 2000 or something like that, so I'm not holding my breath for rasterman...
hahaha.  I've decided that they should all just stick to either KDE or Gnome and stop making all these offshoots.  but that's a whole other debate

Well that's the thing... a lot of the stuff that he's advocating (and writing) will soon be in the core X (Xgl/Xegl/aiglx)... having trouble with aiglx in dapper myself, need to wait until a few more people get exposed to it.
you said "he"... who are you referring to?  Linus?  Mark Shuttleworth?
rasterman
ooho ok, i am reading it correctly now
As long as I'm writing it correctly ;)
or worst yet, vbscript
I thought only a few wireless cards work "out of the box" -- that you still need to do a win32 binary driver install a la ndiswrapper
I've had great luck with several different wireless cards, so maybe it's just me?

It might just be a coincidence... some ARE supported... I've yet to come across one personally that's supported, but I'm aware that they ARE out there and they're popular... I'm probably the isolated one :)
best luck happens with Intel based wireless chipsets

Strange you say that, I found the i810 (video) driver had good hardware support too, for an OSS card... must be Intel then.  I've got an nforce-based mobo on my laptop with a broadcom wireless chip...
I have two gigs of ram... does that mean I can remove swap  ;)
And same question to you :)
Xenguy , althought it's always good to have swap, you really don't need it with more ram.  The more ram you have, the less swap you really need, I'd say 512 is minimum though
THANK you...
